subject: VAM motor support
description_text:
Hello,

I’ve purchased 3 motors + controller from you guys through Amazon a couple
of months ago. My motors suddenly stopped working after 1 month. I thought
the controller had given out since all three stopped at the same time, so I
went ahead and purchased a new controller.

However, after receiving and testing I still have the same issue. So I
think my problem is the motor instead. What’s the best route to get these
replaced? I’m in Canada.

Thank you,

Guilherme D. Martins

conversations.body_text: Hi Guilherme Dias Martins,  You can take a screenshot of the software for me and also a photo of the installation. Please make sure you are using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2; in the vibration interface, the power should show as connected. But if testing the vibration has no response, try connecting each VAM motor individually for testing. In theory, it’s impossible for all three VAMs to be damaged at the same time.

Hello,

Thanks for the response. Please see the requested pictures attached. I have
switched motor connections and tested them individually. Two don’t work at
all and one has a very weak actuation, almost not perceivable.

Thanks again,

Hi Guilherme Dias Martins, I have reviewed the situation. You should not use the VAM Pro mode to control VAM motors, as this can directly damage them. Please operate them in VAM mode instead. Additionally, please provide your order number, shipping address, contact name, and phone number, and we will send you a replacement set of 3 VAM motors.

Hi Guilherme Dias Martins,  First, set the correct mode for the motors in SIMSONN Manager and test the vibration. After that, you can close the software, as it saves the motor mode for each port to the pedal’s main control box. When you open SimHub later, it will automatically use the previously configured motor modes.
